key_residues.description: Experimentally verified. Mutation S77A leads to complete loss of activity due to disruption of nucleophilic attack on the peptide bond.
Experimentally verified. Mutation K80A results in complete loss of activity, indicating its crucial role in substrate stabilization.
Experimentally verified. Mutation Y171A leads to complete loss of activity, suggesting its importance in positioning H307 for proton transfer.
Experimentally verified. Mutation N173A results in complete loss of activity, indicating its involvement in forming the oxyanion hole for intermediate stabilization.
Experimentally verified. Mutation D245A significantly reduces activity, implicating its role in substrate recognition and stabilization.
Experimentally verified. Mutation H307A causes complete loss of activity, confirming its function as a general base catalyst in the acylation and deacylation steps.
Experimentally verified. Mutation S77A leads to complete loss of activity, indicating its role as a nucleophilic site crucial for catalysis.
Experimentally verified. Mutation K80A results in significant reduction of activity, suggesting its importance in stabilizing the substrate during catalysis.
Experimentally verified. Mutation H195A causes loss of activity, confirming its involvement in proton transfer during the catalytic process.
Experimentally verified. Mutation D246A leads to a drastic decrease in activity, indicating its role in coordinating with metal ions in the active site.
